title: hg link not available
body:
Hi glbase development team,

I found glbase3 very useful when doing RNA-seq analysis last year. As I just wanted to use it, however, it seems the hg clone link doesn't exit, seen as below:
`$ hg clone --debug https://bitbucket.org/oaxiom/glbase2using https://bitbucket.org/oaxiom/glbase2
sending capabilities command
abort: HTTP Error 404: Not Found`

Could you provide any solution to this?

Your help will be appreciated.

title: professor, you can use requirements.txt to help other people install the package they need with right version
body:
To create requirements.txt， simply type `**$ pip freeze >requirements.txt**`
To use the requirements.txt, simply  type `**$ pip install -r requirements.txt**`
[python笔记---需求文件requirements.txt的创建及使用](https://blog.csdn.net/loyachen/article/details/52028825)
